definitions.text: the activity of providing for or maintaining by supplying with money or necessities
examples: his support kept the family together
they gave him emotional support during difficult times

definitions.text: aiding the cause or policy or interests of
examples: the president no longer has the support of his own party
they developed a scheme of mutual support

definitions.text: something providing immaterial assistance to a person or cause or interest
examples: the policy found little public support
his faith was all the support he needed
the team enjoyed the support of their fans

definitions.text: a military operation (often involving new supplies of men and materiel) to strengthen a military force or aid in the performance of its mission
examples: they called for artillery support

definitions.text: documentary validation
examples: his documentation of the results was excellent
the strongest support for this view is the work of Jones

definitions.text: the financial means whereby one lives
examples: each child was expected to pay for their keep
he applied to the state for support
he could no longer earn his own livelihood

definitions.text: supporting structure that holds up or provides a foundation
examples: the statue stood on a marble support

definitions.text: the act of bearing the weight of or strengthening
examples: he leaned against the wall for support

definitions.text: a musical part (vocal or instrumental) that supports or provides background for other musical parts
any device that bears the weight of another thing
examples: there was no place to attach supports for a shelf

definitions.text: financial resources provided to make some project possible
examples: the foundation provided support for the experiment

definitions.text: give moral or psychological support, aid, or courage to
examples: She supported him during the illness
Her children always backed her up

definitions.text: support materially or financially
examples: he does not support his natural children
The scholarship supported me when I was in college

definitions.text: be behind; approve of
examples: He plumped for the Labor Party
I backed Kennedy in 1960

definitions.text: be the physical support of; carry the weight of
examples: The beam holds up the roof
He supported me with one hand while I balanced on the beam
What's holding that mirror?

definitions.text: establish or strengthen as with new evidence or facts
examples: his story confirmed my doubts
The evidence supports the defendant

definitions.text: adopt as a belief
examples: I subscribe to your view on abortion

definitions.text: support with evidence or authority or make more certain or confirm
examples: The stories and claims were born out by the evidence

definitions.text: argue or speak in defense of
examples: She supported the motion to strike

definitions.text: play a subordinate role to (another performer)
examples: Olivier supported Gielgud beautifully in the second act

definitions.text: be a regular customer or client of
examples: We patronize this store
Our sponsor kept our art studio going for as long as he could

definitions.text: put up with something or somebody unpleasant
examples: I cannot bear his constant criticism
The new secretary had to endure a lot of unprofessional remarks
he learned to tolerate the heat
She stuck out two years in a miserable marriage
